body: Hi Chris and Mostapha, It seems the **mesh** and the **testpoints** generated by the **Generate Zone Test Points** component are not at the same height, and it seems that the mesh object is always positioned 1m above the floor regardless of the distance of the test points to the floor. See image below. I worry this mismatch might be misleading as the results visualized on the mesh object may not reflect the actual daylight performance as simulated at the height of the test points. Can you kindly help to check and clarify? Thank you! I'm referring to the following demo file on Hydra: [http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&amp...;](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Honeybee_Grid-based_Daylight_Simulation_Example_I&slide=0&scale=2.713208654895345&offset=-702.420564547888,-567.1220793648746) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/y9G3WvU4wnSGcs9pIOjyCOX238MdQiAQj0rlSzpliYE4fEQ3l2Qq-lKmrKB*H5MMeMJVoHxgIHklWIp00oVqD1-Q-4H45POV/Image1.png)
topic: daylight analysis mesh and test points are not at the same height

Grasshope,

Thanks for letting us know.  This seems like a bug and so I fixed it:
